title: (x) New York Style - Serpentine Sans {Tiff}
content:
I've looked around a bit and i found HandelGothic BT, which is similar but not close enough. Any help is greatly appreciated!   
 ![Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826000532im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47646.gif)
author: nosh

comments.content:
The basic letterforms looks like Serpentine without the tiny serifs   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/serpentine/medium-oblique/testdrive.html?s=new+york+style&p=60](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826000532/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/serpentine/medium-oblique/testdrive.html?s=new+york+style&p=60)

Serpentine without serifs would be ' [FF Trademarker](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826000532/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-trademarker/light-italic/testdrive.html?s=new+york+style&p=60)'.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826000532im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
_But its still ( very ) different than the provided sample..   
   
Maybe the serifs of Serpentine just went missing when producing / embroidering it.?_
I think David's right � a lot of detail can get lost in printing, depends on the technology. Those serpentine serifs are pretty subtle to begin with.

Tiffany, nice ID.. _( Strange but true, I never even noticed that a Serpentine Sans existed, at all.. )_   
   
Typophile�, Your ( Endless ) Personal Typographic Learning Experience�.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826000532im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
_Which font do you want to know today�.._
